We went for lunch one day & got  Crepes Salees w/ salads & fries (fries were REALLY crispy & good) and we went back mid-week for the sweet stuff: I got the blueberry, BF got the Cri D'Amour (bananas, nutella, strawberries) -- his was better, but both were yummy. super casual, but really yummy & reasonably priced.
Yum! And friendly staff = great breakfast place in old Montreal

Stopped by here when we first landed in Montreal. It is located at the very tail end of Old Montreal tucked away from the most touristy area. The service was great - the ladies that worked there were very attentive and nice. I liked that the crepes were served with a choice of salad, fries or both. Great fries! The butter, sugar, and maple syrup sweet crepe is amazing! They have changed their name since (Muru Crepe), but the shots of the exterior and interior are exactly the same.

This is a wonderful restaurant with great food, great atmosphere, and great service.  On top of that, the food is beautiful to look at. It's no surprise, the crepes are delicious, but the fries were superb!

This cute café on the outskirts of the main tourist area of old town actually seems like it's patronized by locals and regulars. This was a lovely place for lunch if you're in the mood for crepes. The ambiance was a little fancier than I expected, but it wasn't pretentious at all. My "Delicieux" crepe was excellent, with eggplant, cheese, tomato sauce and veggies. The other crepe we had was a bit over-the-top, with some kind of creamy cheese and veggies. I can't recall the name of it. You can choose salad or frites to accompany your crepe. Tip: If you order the frites, you'll still get a little salad as well. I was only disappointed in the fact that we didn't have room for the dessert crepe with Nutella, strawberries and bananas.

Nice crêpe cafe. Now called Muru Crêpe, I believe. Good location a stone's throw away from Chapelle Notre dame de Bon Secours and Marche Bonsecours.We tried 2 difference savory crêpes and both were delicious

Adorable and delicious cafe worth the walk out of the way before or after a tour of Notre Dame. We had soups and crepes. The cream of vegetable was excellent. I had the Voila crepe with turkey    Swiss and bechemel sauce. The side salad was delicious and the service perfectly tempered.

We went here because of the positive reviews on yelp and unfortunately we were disappointed. We would recommend looking elsewhere if you are in Montreal and looking for a good crepe. Read on if you would like to see our justification. We ordered two breakfast crepes, two coffees and 2 glasses of orange juice. All in bill was $32 before tip. Positives:- good location just on the edge of old Montreal and out of the way from the typical tourist restaurants- servers were nice enough and showed us a table right awayNegatives:- crepes were very greasy, overwhelming amount of cheese, lacking in other contents mentioned on the menu- the sides were weak - the hash brown was overly crispy from being deep fried (also their version of a hash brown was a pre-bought frozen variety - similar to what is found at McDonalds)- the fruit that came with the sides should have had the rind cut off before going on the plate - this just seemed lazy on their part. - crepe shells appear to be pre made and then reheated when an order is taken (I can't verify this as I didn't see the crepes being made) Normal crepes have a consistent pancake brown colour, these ones were yellow with brown spots created from heating after the contents of the crepes were put in. (see the pictures that other reviewers have submitted) - coffee not included in the price of the breakfast crepes despite being included with other breakfast menu items (seemed a little sneaky when the bill arrived) also refills were never offered.- orange juice appeared to be from concentrate... Any restaurant should be able to have not from concentrate OJ- the server could not tell which crepe was which after our order arrived - not a big deal, but thought it was funny since another reviewer mentioned this happened to them.

Lovely lunch spot in the outskirts of Old Montreal.  Calm, quaint atmosphere, cozy yet classy decor.  Loved our window seat.  My expectations of the crepes were a bit too high due to the high yelp ratings... I did enjoy them, but they were not the best crepes I've ever had.  Foodnalysis:- Classique (ham, cheese, egg) breakfast crepe - generous size, almost a large as the non-breakfast crepes. I wasn't extremely hungry, so the breakfast portion was perfect for me.  Came with...- Side salad with mushrooms and tomato - excellent dressing.  - Coffee - great accompaniment.  A trip to a cafe like this in a place like Old Montreal is never complete without coffee!The Bottom Line:Cute spot for crepes in a quieter part of Old Montreal.

I was told by my cousin that one thing I had to eat in Montreal was a crepe, so I looked up Muru Crepe on yelp. I'm so glad I did! My husband and I walked up here when we were exploring Old Montreal. I ordered the Savoyarde crepe and my husband ordered the Attention crepe. He loved the spicy flavors and the chili in his crepe. I thought mine was better, personally. It was savory, creamy, and perfect. Both crepes were stuffed to the brim, which I loved. They didn't skimp on the filings! We both got a green salad and fries. The salad was very good, but the fries were absolutely amazing! I don't know exactly what spices they used on them, but the fries were perfectly salted and had just the right amount of other seasonings. I had to have the waitress take my plate away because I couldn't stop eating them! Love this place and can't wait to go back!

Great place for brunch, lunch or breakfast! Many crepes to choose from and everything I tried at several different times have all been great! The savory crepes are full filling and the sweet ones hit the sweet spot. Wines are basically same price as store so pop a bottle with some friends and enjoy!

Me and my friends were walking around old montreal for the first time when we stumbled along this restaurant. It's a good looking small restaurant and charming. The food is amazing! I had the chicken mushroom sandwich and it was heavenly, also the food was appropriately price. I will definitely come again when visiting Montreal!
This is by far the best crepes I have ever had. We also liked its ambience, decor, and quaint location near old Montreal. The presentation of the crepes was also very well done.

From an american point of view, It was like a gooey quesadilla with ham and cheese in it.  The french fries are spectacular.  I think Montreal just owns fries in general.  I need to go back to try the dessert crepes.

I had a really lovely lunch here today. My croque-madame (a ham and cheese sandwich with a fried egg on top, but it's really just so much more) was delicious, and the salad on the side was much heftier than what you'd expect to get in a similar US establishment. And the staff is mostly bilingual, which was very helpful. I'm thinking I might go back for a breakfast crepe tomorrow.

I have to say, I really hated almost every single meal I had in Montreal, and this place was one of the best. It was an affordable find in the very expensive Vieux Port area.  Good service, the food was really great, and the coffee was warm and bold.If you are touring the area, please come here... unless you really want to spend three times as much around the corner for lunch/

- this place is rated really really high and am semi-surprised....- i love crepes, and it's typically tough to find a good place when you can't get yourself to france. the food was pretty good and well-priced, but the service was terrible. it wasn't really busy but it just seemed as if our server and the food runner/bus boy were on their first day on the job. (no water or menu until we asked for it, they messed up our order, etc)- food ordered** pourquoi pas (chicken, ham, swiss, mushroom sauce) - pretty darn tasty. i would totally recommend this one.** formidable (grilled beef, mushrooms, onions, swiss, red wine sauce) - this one came with the wrong sauce, and the server didnt notice. and neither did we. because of this, the crepe tasted very similar to the pourquoi pas.- don't think i'll be back.... sorry cafe.
Savory crepes had consistency of a wad of glue...yuk...not what I expected.

Delicious sweet crepes!!! Service a tad on the slow side but well worth the worth. The employees try their best ! The savoury crepes are good as well but I really enjoyed the sweet crepe with bananas, strawberries, and nutella. We had the one with nutella only and that was delicious as well! My cappuccino had a heart - it was well done and really tasty!

It may be a few blocks away from the tourist traps, but this place has delicious, affordable crêpes that make for a delicious brunch! Due to the rare combination of great food with reasonable prices, this place fills up quick in the mornings, so make sure to get there early!
So we came to Montreal looking for the perfect Crepe. This place delivered. The savory crepes were excellent, and the dessert crepes were over the top. I would highly recommend finding this place.

I had breakfast here on my recent visit to Montreal. My wife and I had breakfast and sweet Crepes they were all really delicious. The place doesn't stand out on the outside but the decor is very very nice inside. Service was very friendly and prices were reasonable ( $ 30 or so for 3 crepes and coffee). I would definitely come here on my next visit to Montreal.
